definition: victor/winner

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)
sharp/favorable/advantage/benefit/profit/interest/to do good to/to benefit
surname Li

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: The Western victors, however, have secured no such advantages.
sentences.chinese: 然而西方的勝利者卻無此優勢可佔。

sentences.english: One thing is certain, which is, that generally after conquerors follow thieves.
sentences.chinese: 有一點卻是確實的，就是常有小偷跟在勝利者後面。

sentences.english: The victor would win Toydaria's allegiance.
sentences.chinese: 勝利者將贏得託伊達里亞的忠誠。

sentences.english: A new chapter for Libya, but will the victors stay united?
sentences.chinese: 利比亞翻開了新篇章，但勝利者仍會團結一致嗎？

sentences.english: To the victor the less of the spoils the better, should nevertheless be the guideline.
sentences.chinese: 對勝利者來說，戰利品越少越好應當作爲指導方針。

sentences.english: But there aren’t winners when you completely avoid issues, either.
sentences.chinese: 當然如果你避免爭論問題時，同樣也沒有勝利者。

sentences.english: You see, winners simply do what losers don’t want to do.
sentences.chinese: 要明白，勝利者只是做了失敗者不想做的事。

sentences.english: I realize that the world I am describing is the world of the winners.
sentences.chinese: 我意識到我在描述的這個世界是屬於勝利者的世界。

sentences.english: History is written by the victors lies.
sentences.chinese: 歷史，不過是由勝利者書寫的謊言罷了。

sentences.english: The conquered territories were portioned out among the victors.
sentences.chinese: 被征服的領土在勝利者之間被均分了。

sentences.english: The election victor Maithripala Sirisena thanked him.
sentences.chinese: 選舉勝利者西里塞納對此表示感謝。

sentences.english: Yet it's by no means clear that China was the victor.
sentences.chinese: 儘管這絕不意味着中國是這次爭端的勝利者。

sentences.english: History is only written for the conquerers.
sentences.chinese: 歷史只爲勝利者而書寫。

sentences.english: The victors, meanwhile, hung on to power long into their dotage.
sentences.chinese: 與此同時，勝利者則沉浸於長期的掌權之中。
沒有一個勝利者相信機遇。

definition: to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
misconception/fallacy
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to work to no avail (idiom)
to set a trap
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
universally shocking/to offend the whole of society
to boss people around (idiom)
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
rude and unreasonable
feudalism
to be reluctant to give up a post
to incite trouble/to stir up havoc
to smash
